intro: Acoelorraphe wrightii f. inermis, commonly known as the smoothleaf false nettle, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it distinguishable from other members of its genus, particularly the presence of smooth leaf margins and the absence of stinging hairs.
